answers.answer: Yes, the Cytomel could be causing that. What were your last lab results? FT4, FT3, TSH?Do you get any ringing, pounding or pain in your ears? Shaky hands? Rapid heart beat? Diarrhea or softer stools?:) Tamra

I have not had my labs done since starting the Cytomel. My Doc wants me to waitt 2 months.I do not get any ringing, pounding, or pain in my ears, I get the shakes but it is like a lack of sugar or water shakes not just in my hands,  no rapid heart beat, and definately no Diarrhea.I did call my Doc last night and he said I had positional Vertigo caused by a bacterial infection.  aparently it will run its course. I hope so.Thank you for your reply
I don't know what water shakes or sugar shakes are.Have you been tested for diabetes?:) Tamra
I also forgot to ask what time of day you take your Cytomel.:) Tamra

question: 3 years ago I was diagnosed with Hashimoto's Thyroiditis.  I have been on .150 Synthroid for the past year and a half.  a few weeks ago all my symptoms started to return.  Dry skin, tired, constipated, etc...  I had my Doc run a thyroid pannel to see if it was my meds. The results came back that I had to much Thyroid hormone but my body was saying I didn't have enough.  So my Doc perscribed me a lower dose of Synthrtoid and .5mcg of Cytomel. I have been on this combo for a little over a week now.  2 nights ago I started to get dizzy while I was sleeping.  Every time I roled over I would feel llike I was spinning.  The fallowing morning I got up took a shower and started getting dizzy again. this time it was so bad I became cold and clammy and laying and had to lay down.  After about 3.5 hours I was able to get up however I was feeling a little shakey almost like I was dehydrated but I was drinking plenty of water.  By the evening I was feeling better again.  Last night it all started happening again.  The only difference was the intensity was not as bad.Could the Cytomel be causing these symptoms or could there be something else going on?
title: HAving Dizzy spells
